results.title: Discovering electronic music (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bernard Wilets and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Shows something of the physical basis of music and how it can be created and altered by electronic means. Demonstrates the sound synthesizer and its capacity to create, envelop and filter sound. Shows computer controlled music and a composition being created through the use of a computer.

results.title: Discovering color
results.brief_description: Three ways in which colors differ: hue, value and intensity. Hues as parts of the spectrum: red, orange, yellow, green, blue and violet. Between the basic hues are many in-between hues. The value of any hue may be lightened or darkened by adding white or black. The intensity of any hue can be lowered, or dulled, by adding its complementary hue. Techniques of color mixing: the great variety of color in the world around us.

results.title: Discover Australia's national parks
results.brief_description: Shows what to see and do in Australia’s National Parks, their location and the facilities available for visitors. This film shows Port Campbell, Wyperfeld, Mt. Buffalo and Wilson’s Promontory National Parks - all in Victoria. Narrated by Robert Raymond.

results.title: Discipline and self control (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: J Stone and National Audio Visual Center
results.brief_description: Discusses the problem of discipline as one of teaching and living with young children. Shows how a teacher can establish control in a friendly climate and prevent disciplinary problems; discusses adequate supervision, the dangers of over and under control and how to help a child accept control. Filmed at various schools in the United States.

results.title: Disaster fly
results.brief_description: If the screw fly entered Australia the cost to the cattle and sheep industries would be high. The screw worm fly is a danger to all warm-blooded animals, including man, and begins its cycle in flesh wounds. Papua New Guinea is the only screw worm-infected country near Australia, and it is pursuing research into control of this pest

results.title: The Directors
results.brief_description: A ‘Life Magazine’ reporter attempts to analyse the traits of a good director, talking to such noted directors as David Lean, Igmar Bergman, Kurosawa, Fellini and Hitchcock. Discusses the evolution of neo-realism, the technical advances that have brought about cinema verite and the New Wave directors and their influence.

results.title: The Director and the film: David Lean
results.creator_credit: Hazel Wilkinson and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: David Lean in a discussion with actress Maureen Pryor, comments on the aims and techniques he used in ‘The Sound Barrier’, ‘Brief Encounter’, ‘Bridge on the River Kwai’ and ‘Summer Madness’. (nb: A black and white film except for the extract from ‘Summer madness’ which is colour)

results.title: The Director
results.brief_description: Director Don Weis bears the responsibility of supervising every aspect of putting a film together. His talent must encompass acting, camera work, special effects, music, costumes, make-up, scripts, editing and budgeting. This film places the viewer beside a skilful director as he gives shape to a major Hollywood production. Features Robert Wagner in acting role.

results.title: Directing a play
results.creator_credit: Betty Edmonds, Robert Edmonds and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Rehearsals of Louise Dale Spoor’s adaptation of Mark Twain’s “Tom Sawyer” are used to illustrate the work of the director in the performance of a stage play. Shows the first reading of the play by cast and director followed by a discussion of the play, its actions and characters; preliminary work on the stage floor, rehearsals without props; recording of action times and stage movements; the first dress rehearsal.

results.title: Directing a film: Ionesco's 'The New tenant'
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: To better acquaint students with the role of the director in motion picture production, this film takes them behind the scenes both before and during the filming of Eugene Ionesco’s play “The New Tenant”. Scenes from the early stages of planning and preparation are intercut with scenes from the completed film version of the play to enable students to better understand how the director’s initial thoughts and ideas are realized.
